title: HTML select element test
description: A sample select element with opt elements.

talkback.and_chr: Partial support due to the work around needed to activate an option. I was unable to activate an option after double tapping the pop up button. The list was displayed and I could swipe right to navigate options, but double tapping just closed the list and didn't change the value. Work around: swipe right through the entire page until you reach the open options at the end of the page, then you can navigate and make your selection.

vo_ios.ios_saf: Focus was sent back to the select after a choice was made, so the control was announced again with the new value
implied by the pop up button

vo_macos.safari: Implied by the pop up button role

jaws.ie: only conveyed when the pressing up or down arrows while the listbox is closed

dragon_win.chrome: Options within an optgroup are not supported. I said 'click listbox', 'show choices', 'choose banana', and the option was not activated. Saying 'choose everything' instead worked as expected ('everything' is not part of an optgroup).

chrome.output: the "everything" option was chosen, however, options within optgroups could not be chosen.
value was changed to the next option
the "nothing" option was chosen, however, options within optgroups could not be chosen.

results.notes: I said 'click listbox', 'show choices', 'choose nothing', and the option was activated.
I said 'click listbox', 'show choices', 'choose nothing', and the option was activated.
name is implied by reading order

results.notes: failure because it is announced just like a disabled option and users might not be able to tell the difference.

results.notes: failure because it is the same announcement as an optgroup ("double tap to toggle" was not announced) and the two may be confused.

first optgroup label was re-announced with an earcon

ios_saf.notes: The optgroup label is repeated twice, even visually. The first is announced without a role, and the second is announced as a disabled option.

results.notes: Pass because it is spoken without a role, while options are announced as buttons. This lack of a role might imply the optgroup role. This is true even if it is unusual that the optgroup label is then repeated as a disabled option.
conveyed as a button, but that's okay because of the context.

ios_saf.output: "broccoli, button" when within a disabled optgroup and "nothing, dimmed, button" for a disabled option outside of an optgroup

results.notes: only passes when outside of a disabled optgroup

history.message: Added and tested disabled optgroups and options
Update NVDA+FF. Now supports posinet and optgroups. Thanks @smhigley. Also updated other core screen reader combinations.
Added Narrator results for NVDA and JAWS, updated NVDA+Chrome results.
